article:
Ron DeSantis

Ronald Dion DeSantis, known as Ron DeSantis, is an American politician and attorney who has been serving as the 46th Governor of Florida since 2019. A member of the Republican Party, he previously served in the U.S. House of Representatives from 2013 to 2018.

#Early life and education

Ron DeSantis was born on September 14, 1978, in Jacksonville, Florida. He grew up in Dunedin, Florida, where he attended Our Lady of Lourdes Catholic School and later Dunedin High School. DeSantis was captain of the Dunedin High School baseball team and was also an Eagle Scout. After high school, he attended Yale University, where he graduated magna cum laude with a Bachelor of Arts degree in history in 2001. During his time at Yale, DeSantis was a member of the Delta Kappa Epsilon fraternity. He later earned a Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree from Harvard Law School in 2005.

#Military service

After graduating from Yale, DeSantis received a commission in the U.S. Navy through the Navy's Judge Advocate General's Corps program. He completed Naval Justice School in 2004 and served as a JAG officer at the Naval Station Mayport in Florida. In 2007, DeSantis deployed to Iraq as a legal advisor to the U.S. Navy SEAL commander, SEAL Team One. He was awarded the Bronze Star Medal, the Navy and Marine Corps Commendation Medal, and the Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal for his service.

##Post-naval career

After leaving the Navy in 2010, DeSantis worked as a special assistant U.S. attorney in the Middle District of Florida. He later served as a federal prosecutor, handling cases involving public corruption, child exploitation, and national security.

#U.S. House of Representatives (2013–2018)

##Elections

DeSantis was first elected to the U.S. House of Representatives in 2012, representing Florida's 6th congressional district. He defeated Democrat Heather Beaven in the general election, winning 57% of the vote. DeSantis was re-elected in 2014 and 2016, defeating Democratic challengers David Cox and Bill McCullough, respectively.

##Tenure

During his time in Congress, DeSantis served on the House Judiciary Committee, the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee, and the House Foreign Affairs Committee. He was also a member of the Freedom Caucus, a group of conservative Republicans.

###Fiscal policy

DeSantis was a strong advocate for reducing government spending and lowering taxes. He supported the Budget Control Act of 2011, which aimed to reduce the federal deficit by $2.1 trillion over 10 years. DeSantis also voted in favor of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017, which lowered the corporate tax rate from 35% to 21%.

##Committees

DeSantis served on the following committees during his time in Congress:

* House Judiciary Committee
* House Oversight and Government Reform Committee
* House Foreign Affairs Committee
* Freedom Caucus

#Gubernatorial campaigns

##2018 candidacy

In January 2018, DeSantis announced his candidacy for Governor of Florida, running as a Republican. He won the Republican primary in August, defeating Agriculture Commissioner Adam Putnam. In the general election, DeSantis narrowly defeated Democratic nominee Andrew Gillum, winning 49.6% of the vote to Gillum's 49.2%.

##2022 candidacy

DeSantis announced his re-election campaign for Governor of Florida in November 2021. He won the Republican primary unopposed and went on to defeat Democratic nominee Charlie Crist in the general election, winning 59.4% of the vote.

#Governor of Florida (2019–present)

##Economic

As governor, DeSantis has focused on promoting economic growth and job creation. He has signed legislation aimed at reducing regulations and lowering taxes, including a bill that reduces the state's corporate tax rate from 5.5% to 4.462%. DeSantis has also invested in workforce development programs, including vocational training and apprenticeships.

##Education

DeSantis has made education a priority, signing legislation aimed at improving teacher pay and expanding school choice programs. He has also increased funding for vocational training and apprenticeships, as well as programs aimed at improving literacy rates.

##Election law and voting rights

In 2021, DeSantis signed a bill aimed at tightening election laws in Florida, including restrictions on mail-in voting and voter ID requirements. Critics argue that the bill disproportionately affects minority and low-income voters.

##Abortion limits

In 2022, DeSantis signed a bill banning abortion after 15 weeks of pregnancy, with some exceptions. The bill also includes provisions aimed at restricting access to abortion pills.

##Tech platforms

DeSantis has been critical of tech platforms, including Facebook and Twitter, which he accuses of censoring conservative viewpoints. In 2021, he signed a bill aimed at regulating social media companies and preventing them from "censoring" users.

##COVID-19 response

During the COVID-19 pandemic, DeSantis implemented policies aimed at reducing the spread of the virus, including restrictions on gatherings and mask mandates. However, he also faced criticism for his handling of the pandemic, including his decision to lift mask mandates and restrictions on businesses.

##LGBT rights

DeSantis has been criticized for his views on LGBT rights, including his opposition to same-sex marriage and his support for laws aimed at restricting transgender rights.

###Dispute with Disney

In 2022, DeSantis became embroiled in a public dispute with The Walt Disney Company, which he accused of promoting a "woke" agenda. The dispute began when Disney CEO Bob Chapek spoke out against a bill aimed at restricting discussion of LGBTQ+ issues in schools, which DeSantis had signed into law. DeSantis responded by calling for a special session of the state legislature to consider repealing a 1967 law that allows Disney to self-govern its theme park properties.

##Policing and law enforcement

DeSantis has been a strong supporter of law enforcement, signing legislation aimed at increasing funding for police departments and improving officer safety. He has also been critical of movements aimed at defunding the police.

##Immigration and refugees

DeSantis has been a strong supporter of stricter immigration laws, including a bill aimed at banning sanctuary cities in Florida. He has also been critical of refugee resettlement programs.

##Hurricane Ian response

In 2022, DeSantis responded to Hurricane Ian, which devastated parts of southwest Florida. He declared a state of emergency and deployed the National Guard to assist with relief efforts.

##Environment

#2024 presidential campaign

#Personal life

DeSantis is married to Casey DeSantis, a former television journalist. The couple has three children together. DeSantis is a practicing Roman Catholic.

2022 Asian Men's U20 Volleyball Championship

The 2022 Asian Men's U20 Volleyball Championship was the 21st edition of the Asian Men's U20 Volleyball Championship, a biennial international volleyball tournament organized by the Asian Volleyball Confederation (AVC) for the men's national teams of the U20 category. The tournament was held in Riffa, Bahrain from 24 August to 31 August 2022.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2022 Asian Men's U20 Volleyball Championship was held in various locations across Asia from 2021 to 2022. A total of 16 teams qualified for the tournament.

# Format

The tournament was played in two phases: the preliminary round and the final round. The preliminary round featured a round-robin format, where each team played the other teams in their pool. The top two teams from each pool advanced to the final round, while the bottom two teams played in the 13th-17th playoffs.

# Venues

The tournament was held at the Bahrain Handball Federation Hall in Riffa, Bahrain.

article:
2022 World Series

The 2022 World Series was the championship series of Major League Baseball's (MLB) 2022 season. The 118th edition of the Fall Classic, it was played between the American League (AL) champion Houston Astros and the National League (NL) champion Philadelphia Phillies. The series began on October 28 and ended on November 5.

#Background

##Houston Astros

The Houston Astros entered the 2022 postseason as the AL West division champions, finishing the regular season with a 106-56 record, the best in the American League. This marked the sixth consecutive season the Astros had won 100 or more games. Led by manager Dusty Baker, the team featured a strong lineup with players such as Yordan Alvarez, Jose Altuve, and Jeremy Pena, as well as a deep pitching staff anchored by Justin Verlander, Framber Valdez, and Cristian Javier. The Astros were seeking their second World Series title in six years, having last won in 2017.

##Philadelphia Phillies

The Philadelphia Phillies, led by manager Rob Thomson, secured their first NL pennant since 2009 by defeating the San Diego Padres in the NLCS. They finished the regular season with an 87-75 record, third in the NL East. The team's lineup was powered by Bryce Harper, Kyle Schwarber, and Rhys Hoskins, while the pitching staff was led by Zack Wheeler, Aaron Nola, and Ranger Suarez. The Phillies were attempting to win their first World Series title since 2008 and their third overall.

#Summary

The Houston Astros won the series 4-2, capturing their second World Series title in franchise history. The series was marked by strong pitching performances from both teams, with the Astros ultimately outscoring the Phillies 25-15. Jeremy Pena was named the World Series MVP after hitting .400 with 2 home runs and 3 RBIs.

#Game summaries

##Game 1

Game 1 was played at Minute Maid Park in Houston, Texas, on October 28. The Astros took an early lead on a Jeremy Pena home run in the bottom of the first inning. Justin Verlander started for the Astros, allowing 2 runs on 4 hits over 5 innings. The Phillies' Zack Wheeler pitched 5 innings, giving up 3 runs on 6 hits. The Astros bullpen, led by Rafael Montero and Ryan Pressly, shut down the Phillies in the late innings, securing a 6-5 Astros victory.

##Game 2

In Game 2, the Astros' Framber Valdez pitched a strong 6 innings, allowing 1 run on 4 hits. The Phillies' Aaron Nola was equally effective, giving up 2 runs on 4 hits over 5 innings. The Astros took the lead on a Yordan Alvarez home run in the bottom of the sixth inning and held on for a 5-2 win.

##Game 3

The series shifted to Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, for Game 3 on October 31. The Phillies' Bryce Harper hit a 2-run home run in the bottom of the first inning, giving the Phillies an early lead. Ranger Suarez pitched 5 innings for the Phillies, allowing 2 runs on 5 hits. The Astros' Lance McCullers Jr. pitched 4 innings, giving up 3 runs on 6 hits. The Phillies bullpen, led by Jose Alvarado and David Robertson, shut down the Astros in the late innings, securing a 7-0 Phillies victory.

##Game 4

In Game 4, the Astros' Cristian Javier pitched a strong 6 innings, allowing 1 run on 2 hits. The Phillies' Zack Wheeler was equally effective, giving up 2 runs on 5 hits over 5 innings. The Astros took the lead on a Jeremy Pena sacrifice fly in the top of the seventh inning and held on for a 5-0 win.

##Game 5

The Phillies' Noah Syndergaard pitched 3 innings in Game 5, allowing 2 runs on 4 hits. The Astros' Justin Verlander pitched 5 innings, giving up 1 run on 4 hits. The Astros took the lead on a Yordan Alvarez home run in the top of the sixth inning and held on for a 3-2 win.

##Game 6

In Game 6, the Astros' Framber Valdez pitched a strong 6 innings, allowing 1 run on 4 hits. The Phillies' Zack Wheeler was equally effective, giving up 2 runs on 5 hits over 5 innings. The Astros took the lead on a Jeremy Pena home run in the top of the seventh inning and held on for a 4-1 win, securing the World Series title.

##Composite line score

#Broadcasting

##Television

The 2022 World Series was televised by Fox in the United States, with Joe Buck providing play-by-play commentary and John Smoltz serving as color commentator. The series was also broadcast in Spanish on Fox Deportes, with Adrian Garcia Marquez and Edgar Gonzalez providing commentary.

###Ratings

The series averaged a 6.5 household rating and 12.1 million viewers per game, according to Nielsen Media Research. Game 6 drew a 7.4 household rating and 14.4 million viewers, making it the highest-rated and most-watched game of the series.

##Radio

The 2022 World Series was broadcast on ESPN Radio, with Dan Shulman providing play-by-play commentary and Eduardo Perez serving as color commentator.

#Sponsorship

The 2022 World Series was sponsored by several companies, including Chevrolet, Budweiser, and Mastercard. The series also featured several promotional partners, including Taco Bell, Apple, and Coca-Cola.

#Aftermath

##Houston

The Astros celebrated their World Series title with a parade through downtown Houston on November 7. The team was honored at a rally at Minute Maid Park, where players and coaches were presented with championship rings.

##Philadelphia

The Phillies held a rally at Citizens Bank Park on November 7, where players and coaches were honored for their NL pennant-winning season. The team also held a parade through the streets of Philadelphia, which was attended by thousands of fans.

article:
Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake

Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake is a spin-off series of the popular American animated television series Adventure Time. The series is based on the characters of Fionna and Cake, who were introduced in the third season of Adventure Time. The show follows the adventures of Fionna, a human girl, and her cat, Cake, in a post-apocalyptic Land of Ooo.

# Synopsis

The series takes place in a parallel universe to the original Adventure Time series and follows the adventures of Fionna and Cake as they navigate the Land of Ooo. The show's storyline is not directly connected to the original series, but it does share some similarities and Easter eggs for fans of the original show. Fionna and Cake's adventures often involve battling monsters, exploring new lands, and interacting with other characters from the Adventure Time universe.

# Cast

## Main

* Madeleine Martin as Fionna, the human protagonist of the show
* Roz Ryan as Cake, Fionna's cat companion

## Supporting

* Cole Sanchez as Lord Monochromicorn, a villainous character who appears in several episodes
* Tom Kenny as Simon Petrikov, a character from the original Adventure Time series who makes several appearances in Fionna and Cake
* Olivia Olson as Marceline the Vampire Queen, a character from the original Adventure Time series who appears in several episodes

# Episodes

The first season of Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake consists of 10 episodes, each with a unique storyline and adventure. Some notable episodes include "The Quest for the Golden Scone," "The Monster of the Week," and "The Secret of the Haunted Treehouse." The episodes are designed to be standalone, but they do contribute to the overall storyline of the series.

# Production

## Concept and creation

The idea for Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake was first conceived by Pendleton Ward, the creator of the original Adventure Time series. Ward wanted to explore the characters of Fionna and Cake in more depth and create a spin-off series that would appeal to fans of the original show. The concept was developed in collaboration with Cartoon Network, and the series was officially announced in 2020.

## Development

The development of Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake involved a team of writers, animators, and designers who worked together to bring the series to life. The show's storyline was developed over several months, with input from Ward and other members of the original Adventure Time team. The characters and settings were designed to be consistent with the original series, while also introducing new elements and storylines.

## Production design

The production design of Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake was led by a team of experienced animators and designers. The show's visual style is consistent with the original Adventure Time series, with a mix of traditional animation and computer-generated imagery. The characters and settings were designed to be colorful and imaginative, with a focus on creating a unique and immersive world.

# Release

Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake premiered on Cartoon Network in August 2023. The series was released simultaneously on the Cartoon Network app and on various streaming platforms, including HBO Max and Amazon Prime Video. The show was promoted through a series of trailers and promotional videos, which were released in the months leading up to the premiere.

# Reception

## Critical reception

Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. Reviewers praised the show's unique storyline, colorful animation, and imaginative characters. The show was praised for its ability to appeal to both fans of the original Adventure Time series and new viewers who were unfamiliar with the franchise.

## LGBTQ+ representation

Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake features several LGBTQ+ characters, including a same-sex couple who appear in several episodes. The show's portrayal of LGBTQ+ characters was praised by critics and fans, who appreciated the show's inclusive and diverse representation.

## Accolades

Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake has received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Animated Series at the 2023 Annie Awards. The show has also been praised for its positive portrayal of women and girls, and for its ability to appeal to a diverse range of viewers.

article:
Tornado Outbreak of March 31 – April 1, 2023

A significant tornado outbreak occurred on March 31 and April 1, 2023, across the central and southern United States. The outbreak produced a total of 24 confirmed tornadoes, with the majority of them occurring on April 1. The tornadoes caused widespread damage, injuries, and fatalities across several states, including Arkansas, Iowa, Tennessee, Illinois, and Indiana.

# Meteorological Synopsis

## March 31

On March 31, a low-pressure system developed over the Rocky Mountains and began to move eastward. As the system interacted with a cold front, it produced a swath of severe thunderstorms across the Great Plains. While the storms were not tornadic, they did produce large hail and damaging winds. The storms eventually weakened as they moved east of the Mississippi River.

## April 1

On April 1, the low-pressure system continued to move eastward, and a new cold front developed to its south. As the cold front interacted with the warm, moist air from the Gulf of Mexico, it produced a significant outbreak of severe thunderstorms. The storms developed across the southern United States, particularly in Arkansas, Tennessee, and Mississippi. The storms were fueled by strong wind shear, which allowed them to become supercells and produce tornadoes.

# Confirmed Tornadoes

## Little Rock–North Little Rock–Jacksonville, Arkansas

The first tornado of the outbreak occurred at 1:45 PM CDT in Pulaski County, Arkansas. The tornado was rated EF1 and caused significant damage to buildings and trees. The tornado moved northeast and affected the cities of Little Rock, North Little Rock, and Jacksonville. Several buildings were destroyed, and numerous power lines were knocked down.

## Keota–Wellman, Iowa

At 3:15 PM CDT, a tornado touched down in Keokuk County, Iowa. The tornado was rated EF2 and caused significant damage to buildings and crops. The tornado moved east and affected the towns of Keota and Wellman. Several buildings were destroyed, and numerous trees were uprooted.

## Wynne–Parkin–Turrell, Arkansas/Drummonds–Burlison, Tennessee

At 4:30 PM CDT, a long-lived tornado touched down in Cross County, Arkansas. The tornado was rated EF2 and caused significant damage to buildings and trees. The tornado moved northeast and affected the cities of Wynne, Parkin, and Turrell. The tornado then crossed into Tennessee and affected the towns of Drummonds and Burlison. Several buildings were destroyed, and numerous power lines were knocked down.

## Brighton–Covington–Brownsville, Tennessee

At 6:00 PM CDT, a tornado touched down in Tipton County, Tennessee. The tornado was rated EF1 and caused significant damage to buildings and trees. The tornado moved east and affected the towns of Brighton, Covington, and Brownsville. Several buildings were destroyed, and numerous power lines were knocked down.

## Ste. Marie–Robinson, Illinois/Merom–Sullivan, Indiana

At 7:30 PM CDT, a tornado touched down in Jasper County, Illinois. The tornado was rated EF2 and caused significant damage to buildings and crops. The tornado moved east and affected the towns of Ste. Marie and Robinson. The tornado then crossed into Indiana and affected the towns of Merom and Sullivan. Several buildings were destroyed, and numerous trees were uprooted.

## Bethel Springs–Adamsville–Hookers Bend–Hohenwald, Tennessee

At 9:00 PM CDT, a long-lived tornado touched down in McNairy County, Tennessee. The tornado was rated EF2 and caused significant damage to buildings and trees. The tornado moved northeast and affected the towns of Bethel Springs, Adamsville, Hookers Bend, and Hohenwald. Several buildings were destroyed, and numerous power lines were knocked down.

# Non-Tornadic Effects

## Tennessee

In addition to the tornadoes, Tennessee experienced significant straight-line wind damage. Winds gusted up to 70 mph, causing widespread power outages and property damage.

## Blizzard

On April 1, a blizzard warning was issued for parts of the Midwest, including Illinois and Indiana. Heavy snowfall and high winds caused hazardous travel conditions, with drifts reaching up to 5 feet in some areas.

# Impact and Aftermath

The tornado outbreak caused significant damage and disruption across the affected areas. Several people were injured, and at least one fatality was reported. Emergency responders and crews worked to restore power and clear debris. The American Red Cross and other organizations provided assistance to those affected by the tornadoes.

Coronation of Mary I of England

The coronation of Mary I of England took place on July 19, 1553, at Westminster Abbey in London. The ceremony marked the beginning of Mary's reign as the Queen of England and Ireland, following the death of her half-brother, King Edward VI. The coronation was a grand affair, with elaborate processions, ceremonies, and festivities that showcased the wealth and power of the English monarchy.

#Proclamation on 19 July

The coronation day began with a proclamation, which was read out in various parts of the city, declaring Mary as the rightful Queen of England and Ireland. The proclamation was an important step in establishing Mary's legitimacy and authority, as it publicly declared her as the monarch and commanded the loyalty and obedience of her subjects.

#The Oration gratulatory

As part of the coronation ceremony, a special oration, known as the Oration gratulatory, was delivered by the Bishop of Durham, Cuthbert Tunstall. The oration was a formal speech that praised Mary's virtues and abilities, and expressed the hopes and expectations of the nation for her reign. The Oration gratulatory was an important part of the coronation ceremony, as it provided an opportunity for the Church to bless and legitimize the new monarch.

#Plays and drama at the coronation

The coronation ceremony also featured several plays and dramatic performances, which were intended to entertain and educate the audience. These performances included a pageant of the nine worthies, a representation of the three estates of the realm, and a masque of the virtues. The plays and dramas were an integral part of the coronation ceremony, as they helped to reinforce the themes of power, authority, and legitimacy that were central to the occasion.

#Royal Entry to London

The Royal Entry to London was a grand procession that took place on the eve of the coronation. The procession was led by Mary, who rode through the streets of London in a magnificent carriage, accompanied by her nobles and courtiers. The Royal Entry was an important part of the coronation ceremony, as it provided an opportunity for Mary to showcase her power and authority to her subjects.

##Coronation eve

On the eve of the coronation, Mary attended a special service at Westminster Abbey, where she prayed and prepared herself for the ceremony ahead. The service was attended by the nobles and courtiers, who came to pay their respects to the new monarch.

##The coronation entry

The coronation entry was a grand procession that took place on the morning of the coronation. The procession was led by Mary, who rode through the streets of London in a magnificent carriage, accompanied by her nobles and courtiers. The coronation entry was an important part of the coronation ceremony, as it provided an opportunity for Mary to showcase her power and authority to her subjects.

#Coronation

The coronation ceremony took place at Westminster Abbey, and was attended by the nobles and courtiers of the realm. The ceremony was led by the Archbishop of York, Thomas Cranmer, who anointed Mary with holy oil and crowned her with the imperial crown.

##The mount and St Edward's chair

The coronation ceremony took place on a special mount, known as the coronation mount, which was erected in the center of the abbey. The mount was surrounded by a platform, known as the traverse, which provided a space for the nobles and courtiers to stand. At the top of the mount was St Edward's chair, a special throne that was used in the coronation ceremony.

##The traverse

The traverse was a platform that surrounded the coronation mount, and provided a space for the nobles and courtiers to stand. The traverse was an important part of the coronation ceremony, as it provided a space for the nobles and courtiers to participate in the ceremony and to pay their respects to the new monarch.

##Three crowns and two sceptres

Mary was crowned with three crowns, which represented her roles as Queen of England, Queen of Ireland, and Queen of France. She also held two sceptres, which represented her power and authority as monarch. The three crowns and two sceptres were an important part of the coronation ceremony, as they symbolized Mary's power and authority as monarch.

#Banquet in Westminster Hall

After the coronation ceremony, a grand banquet was held in Westminster Hall, which was attended by the nobles and courtiers of the realm. The banquet was an important part of the coronation celebrations, as it provided an opportunity for the nobles and courtiers to come together and to celebrate the new monarch.

##The champion

At the banquet, a special champion, known as the champion of the realm, rode into the hall on horseback, and threw down a gauntlet, challenging anyone to come forward and dispute Mary's right to the throne. The champion was an important part of the coronation celebrations, as it provided a symbol of Mary's power and authority as monarch.

##Proclamation

At the end of the banquet, a proclamation was read out, declaring Mary as the rightful Queen of England and Ireland, and commanding the loyalty and obedience of her subjects. The proclamation was an important part of the coronation celebrations, as it reinforced Mary's legitimacy and authority as monarch.

#Costume

The coronation ceremony was a grand and elaborate affair, with intricate costumes and finery. Mary wore a magnificent gown, made of blue and ray cloth, which was embroidered with gold and silver thread. The gown was an important part of the coronation ceremony, as it symbolized Mary's power and authority as monarch.

##Blue and ray cloth

The blue and ray cloth was a special fabric, made from the silk of the golden spider, which was said to have been brought back from the New World by the Spanish conquistadors. The blue and ray cloth was an important part of the coronation ceremony, as it symbolized Mary's power and authority as monarch.

##Anointing and a change of costume

During the coronation ceremony, Mary was anointed with holy oil, and changed into a special costume, made of white and gold, which symbolized her new role as monarch. The anointing and change of costume were an important part of the coronation ceremony, as they symbolized Mary's transformation into a monarch.

##Gentlewomen and chamberers

Mary was attended by a group of gentlewomen and chamberers, who helped her to prepare for the coronation ceremony and to change into her new costume. The gentlewomen and chamberers were an important part of the coronation ceremony, as they provided a symbol of Mary's power and authority as monarch.

##Reuse of coronation clothes by Elizabeth I

After Mary's death, her coronation clothes were reused by her half-sister, Elizabeth I, who wore them during her own coronation ceremony in 1559. The reuse of the coronation clothes was an important symbol of Elizabeth's connection to her sister and predecessor, and reinforced her own legitimacy and authority as monarch.

Dylan O'Donnell

Dylan O'Donnell is a Australian astrophotographer, best known for his stunning images of the night sky, which have been featured in various international publications and exhibitions. With a passion for astronomy and photography, O'Donnell has established himself as one of the leading figures in the field of astrophotography.

Dylan O'Donnell was born on [date] in [place], Australia. Growing up in a rural area, O'Donnell was fascinated by the night sky and spent many hours gazing up at the stars. His interest in astronomy was encouraged by his parents, who gifted him a telescope when he was just a teenager. O'Donnell's early experiences with the telescope sparked a lifelong passion for astronomy and the pursuit of capturing the beauty of the night sky through photography.

O'Donnell pursued his passion for astronomy and photography through formal education, earning a degree in astrophysics from [university name]. During his time at university, O'Donnell honed his skills in photography and developed a deep understanding of the technical aspects of astrophotography.

article:
Lata Mangeshkar

Lata Mangeshkar (September 28, 1929 – February 6, 2022) was a renowned Indian playback singer who was widely regarded as one of the greatest vocalists in Indian cinema. With a career spanning over seven decades, she recorded songs in over 36 languages and is estimated to have sung over 30,000 songs. Mangeshkar's contribution to Indian music and cinema is immeasurable, and she remains an iconic figure in the entertainment industry.

#Early life

Lata Mangeshkar was born on September 28, 1929, in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, to Deenanath Mangeshkar, a Marathi theater actor and musician, and Shevanti Mangeshkar. She was the eldest of five siblings, including Asha Bhosle, Usha Mangeshkar, Meena Mangeshkar, and Hridaynath Mangeshkar. The family was deeply rooted in music and theater, and Mangeshkar's early life was influenced by her father's musical background.

Mangeshkar began singing at a young age and received formal training in classical music from her father and later from Aman Ali Khan Sahib and Amanat Khan. She also learned to play the harmonium and the tanpura, which became an integral part of her singing style.

#Singing career

##Early career in the 1940s

Mangeshkar's singing career began in the 1940s, when she started performing on stage and recording songs for Marathi films. Her first recorded song was "Natali Chaitraachi" for the Marathi film Kiti Hasaal (1942). She also sang for the Marathi film Pahili Mangalagaur (1942) and the Hindi film Tamanna (1942).

In 1945, Mangeshkar moved to Mumbai with her family, where she began to work as a playback singer for Hindi films. Her first major break came with the song "Paa Lagoon Kar Jori" from the film Aap Ki Sewa Mein (1947). The song was a huge success, and Mangeshkar's voice became an instant hit with the audience.

##1950s

The 1950s were a defining period in Mangeshkar's career. She sang for some of the biggest hits of the decade, including "Aayega Aane Wala" from the film Mahal (1949), "Aji Dil Ho Kaabu Mein To" from the film Baadal (1951), and "Lag Jaa Gale" from the film Woh Kaun Thi? (1964).

Mangeshkar's collaboration with music directors like Shankar-Jaikishan, S.D. Burman, and Naushad Ali resulted in some of the most memorable songs of the decade. Her voice became synonymous with the Hindi film industry, and she became the go-to singer for leading actresses of the time.

##1960s

The 1960s saw Mangeshkar's career reach new heights. She sang for some of the biggest films of the decade, including Mughal-e-Azam (1960), Ganga Jamuna (1961), and Guide (1965). Her songs from these films, such as "Pyar Kiya To Darna Kya" and "Aaj Kal Tere Mere Pyar Ke Charche", are still widely popular today.

Mangeshkar's collaboration with music director Laxmikant-Pyarelal resulted in some of the biggest hits of the decade, including "Duniya Na Mane" from the film Abhinetri (1970) and "Main Nikla Gaddi Leke" from the film Hum Dono (1961).

##1970s

The 1970s saw a new generation of music directors emerge, and Mangeshkar's voice adapted to the changing musical landscape. She sang for films like Bobby (1973), Amar Prem (1972), and Daag (1973), and her songs from these films, such as "Hum Tum Ek Kamre Mein Band Ho" and "Chingari Koi Bhadke", are still widely popular today.

Mangeshkar's collaboration with music director R.D. Burman resulted in some of the most iconic songs of the decade, including "Mera Kuchh Saamaan" from the film Ijaazat (1987) and "Tum Aa Gaye Ho Noor Aa Gaya" from the film Aandhi (1975).

##1980s

The 1980s saw Mangeshkar's career slow down slightly, but she continued to sing for some of the biggest films of the decade. She sang for films like Souten (1983), Ram Teri Ganga Maili (1985), and Chandni (1989), and her songs from these films, such as "Shayad Meri Shaadi" and "Lag Jaa Gale Se", are still widely popular today.

Mangeshkar's collaboration with music director Shiv-Hari resulted in some of the most memorable songs of the decade, including "Tere Liye" from the film Chandni (1989) and "Chaudhvin Ka Chand" from the film Chandni (1989).

##1990s

The 1990s saw Mangeshkar's career experience a resurgence, thanks to the emergence of new music directors and the rise of the playback singing industry. She sang for films like Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge (1995), Kuch Kuch Hota Hai (1998), and Hum Aapke Hain Koun..! (1994), and her songs from these films, such as "Mere Khwabon Mein" and "Tujhe Dekha To", are still widely popular today.

Mangeshkar's collaboration with music director A.R. Rahman resulted in some of the most iconic songs of the decade, including "Khamoshiyan Gungunane Lagi" from the film One 2 Ka 4 (2001) and "Lukka Chuppi" from the film Rang De Basanti (2006).

##2000s

The 2000s saw Mangeshkar's career slow down slightly, but she continued to sing for some of the biggest films of the decade. She sang for films like Veer-Zaara (2004), Bunty Aur Babli (2005), and Fanaa (2006), and her songs from these films, such as "Lodi" and "Chanda Chamke", are still widely popular today.

Mangeshkar's collaboration with music director Shankar-Ehsaan-Loy resulted in some of the most memorable songs of the decade, including "Mitwa" from the film Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna (2006) and "Tere Naina" from the film My Name Is Khan (2010).

##2010s

The 2010s saw Mangeshkar's career slow down significantly, but she continued to sing for some of the biggest films of the decade. She sang for films like My Name Is Khan (2010), Dabangg (2010), and Ek Tha Tiger (2012), and her songs from these films, such as "Tere Naina" and "Mashallah", are still widely popular today.

Mangeshkar's collaboration with music director Vishal-Shekhar resulted in some of the most iconic songs of the decade, including "Dil Dhadakne Do" from the film Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara (2011) and "Thug Le" from the film Ladies vs Ricky Bahl (2011).

##2020s

The 2020s saw Mangeshkar's career come to an end, as she passed away on February 6, 2022, at the age of 92. Despite her passing, her legacy lives on, and her songs continue to be widely popular today.

##Bengali career

Mangeshkar also had a successful career in Bengali cinema, singing for films like Jiban Mrityu (1967), Antony Firingee (1967), and Deya Neya (1963). Her songs from these films, such as "Amar Swapna Tumi" and "Ei Raat Tomar Amar", are still widely popular today.

#Collaboration with other singers

Mangeshkar collaborated with many other singers during her career, including Asha Bhosle, Kishore Kumar, and Mohammed Rafi. Some of her most popular duets include "Achha Ji Main Haari" with Asha Bhosle, "Yeh Kya Hua" with Kishore Kumar, and "Tere Mere Milan Ki" with Mohammed Rafi.

#Non-singing career

##Music direction

Mangeshkar also worked as a music director for several films, including Ram Ram Pavna (1950) and Adalat (1958). Her music direction was well-received by critics and audiences alike.

##Production

Mangeshkar also worked as a producer for several films, including Lekin... (1991) and Kavita (1976). Her production company, Mangeshkar Films, produced several successful films during the 1970s and 1980s.

#Illness and death

Mangeshkar was admitted to the Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai on January 8, 2022, after testing positive for COVID-19. She was 92 years old at the time and had several underlying health conditions. Despite receiving treatment, her condition deteriorated, and she passed away on February 6, 2022, at 8:12 am IST.

#Awards and recognition

Mangeshkar received numerous awards and accolades during her career, including three National Film Awards, 12 Bengal Film Journalists' Association Awards, and four Filmfare Awards. She was also awarded the Padma Bhushan in 1969 and the Padma Vibhushan in 1999.

#Controversy

Mangeshkar was involved in several controversies during her career, including a highly publicized feud with Mohammed Rafi in the 1960s. She also faced criticism for her decision to sing for films that were deemed "obscene" or "vulgar" by some critics.

article:
Death and Funeral of Pope Benedict XVI

Pope Benedict XVI was the head of the Catholic Church and the sovereign of the Vatican City from 2005 until his resignation in 2013. He passed away on December 31, 2022, at the age of 95, marking the end of an era for the Catholic Church and the world. This article provides an overview of the events surrounding his death and funeral, as well as the reactions from around the globe.

#Background

Pope Benedict XVI was born Joseph Aloisius Ratzinger on April 16, 1927, in Marktl am Inn, Germany. 2022 Saskatchewan stabbings

On September 4, 2022, a series of stabbings occurred in multiple locations in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan, resulting in one of the deadliest mass stabbings in Canadian history. The attacks, which took place in the James Smith Cree Nation and the nearby village of Weldon, left 11 people dead and 18 others injured. This article provides an overview of the events surrounding the stabbings, the perpetrator, and the reactions to the tragedy.

# Events

## Prelude to the attacks

In the days leading up to the stabbings, there were reports of a disturbance at a residence in the James Smith Cree Nation, which is located about 320 kilometers northeast of Saskatoon. The disturbance involved a dispute between two men, one of whom was later identified as the perpetrator of the stabbings. The cause of the dispute is not known, but it is believed to have been a contributing factor to the events that unfolded on September 4.

## Attacks

On the morning of September 4, 2022, a series of stabbings occurred in multiple locations in the James Smith Cree Nation and the village of Weldon. The attacks began at around 5:40 am, when police received reports of a stabbing at a residence in the James Smith Cree Nation. Over the next few hours, police received reports of additional stabbings at other locations, including residences, a convenience store, and a golf course. The attacks were carried out by a lone perpetrator, who was armed with a knife and was targeting victims at random.

## Police response

Police were quickly dispatched to the scene, and a massive manhunt was launched to apprehend the perpetrator. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) and other law enforcement agencies were involved in the response, which included air support and canine units. Police warned residents of the James Smith Cree Nation and the village of Weldon to remain indoors and to avoid confronting the perpetrator.

article:
East Palestine, Ohio, Train Derailment

The East Palestine, Ohio, train derailment was a major railroad accident that occurred on February 3, 2023, in East Palestine, Ohio, United States. The derailment involved a Norfolk Southern Railway freight train carrying hazardous materials, resulting in a large fire, environmental concerns, and a significant impact on the local community.

#Background

East Palestine is a small town in Columbiana County, Ohio, with a population of approximately 4,700 people. The town is located near the Pennsylvania border, about 20 miles southeast of Youngstown. The Norfolk Southern Railway runs through the town, and the derailment occurred on a section of track near the intersection of Main Street and Park Avenue.

#Derailment

On February 3, 2023, at approximately 8:54 p.m. local time, a Norfolk Southern Railway freight train derailed in East Palestine, Ohio. The train, which consisted of 151 cars, was traveling from Illinois to Pennsylvania when it derailed. The cause of the derailment is still under investigation. The derailment resulted in a large fire, with several cars carrying hazardous materials, including vinyl chloride and ethylene glycol monobutyl ether.

#Emergency Response and Burn Off

Emergency responders were quickly dispatched to the scene, and a large response effort was undertaken. The fire was allowed to burn for several days, with responders working to contain the blaze and prevent it from spreading. On February 6, 2023, a controlled burn of the remaining hazardous materials was conducted. The burn off, also known as a "vent and burn," was intended to safely dispose of the remaining hazardous materials.

##Burnoff Unnecessary

Some experts have questioned the necessity of the burn off, suggesting that it may have been unnecessary and potentially harmful to the environment and public health. The burn off released large quantities of toxic chemicals into the air, including dioxins and furans, which are known to be carcinogenic.

#Health and Environmental Concerns

The derailment and subsequent burn off have raised significant concerns about the impact on public health and the environment. Residents in the surrounding area have reported symptoms such as headaches, nausea, and respiratory problems. The Ohio Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has been monitoring air and water quality in the area, and some contaminants have been detected.

##Waste Disposal

The derailment has also raised concerns about waste disposal. The hazardous materials involved in the derailment require special handling and disposal. The EPA has been working with Norfolk Southern to ensure that the waste is disposed of properly.

##Independent Testing

Some residents have called for independent testing of the air and water quality in the area. The Ohio EPA has been conducting its own testing, but some residents have expressed concerns that the testing may not be comprehensive enough.

##Whistleblower and Cover-up Allegations

A whistleblower has come forward alleging that Norfolk Southern had been aware of potential safety issues with the train's brakes before the derailment. The whistleblower also alleged that the company had attempted to cover up the issue. Norfolk Southern has denied the allegations.

#Aftermath

The derailment has had a significant impact on the local community. Residents have been displaced, and businesses have been affected. The incident has also raised concerns about the safety of the rail industry and the need for improved regulations.

##Lawsuits and Compensation

Several lawsuits have been filed against Norfolk Southern, seeking compensation for damages and injuries. The company has also established a fund to provide compensation to affected residents.

##NTSB Board Meeting and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) held a board meeting to discuss the derailment. The NTSB found that the probable cause of the derailment was a broken wheel bearing, which had been undetected by the train's safety systems.

##Federal Railroad Administration Safety Culture Assessment

The Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) conducted a safety culture assessment of Norfolk Southern. The assessment found that the company had a reactive safety culture, which prioritized on-time performance over safety.

#Inquiry and Cause

The cause of the derailment is still under investigation. The NTSB has been leading the investigation, with assistance from the FRA and other agencies.

##Hearings

Several hearings have been held to investigate the derailment. The hearings have focused on the safety of the rail industry and the need for improved regulations.

##Brakes

The investigation has also focused on the train's brakes, which were found to be faulty. The NTSB has recommended that the FRA require more frequent brake inspections.

#Reactions

The derailment has sparked a range of reactions, from concerns about public safety to calls for improved regulations.

##Congress

Several members of Congress have called for improved regulations and increased funding for rail safety.

##Misinformation

There have been reports of misinformation and conspiracy theories surrounding the derailment. Some have falsely claimed that the derailment was intentional or that it was caused by a cyberattack.

##Comparisons

The derailment has been compared to other major rail accidents, including the 2013 Lac-Megantic oil train derailment in Canada.

article:
Vande Bharat Express

The Vande Bharat Express, also known as Train 18, is a high-speed, semi-bullet train service operated by Indian Railways. It is the fastest train in India, with a maximum speed of 180 km/h (112 mph). The train was designed and manufactured by the Integral Coach Factory (ICF) in Chennai, and its introduction marks a significant milestone in India's efforts to modernize its rail network.

#History

##Efforts to increase speed (1960–2016)

India's rail network has been in operation since the 19th century, and for many years, the focus was on expanding the network and increasing capacity. However, as the network grew, so did concerns about speed and efficiency. In the 1960s, Indian Railways began exploring ways to increase the speed of its trains, with the introduction of the Rajdhani Express in 1968, which had a maximum speed of 120 km/h (75 mph). Over the years, Indian Railways continued to experiment with new technologies and train designs to increase speed, including the introduction of the Shatabdi Express in 1988, which had a maximum speed of 150 km/h (93 mph).

##Making an indigenous trainset (2016–19)

In 2016, Indian Railways decided to take a new approach to increasing speed by designing and manufacturing an indigenous trainset. The project, codenamed "Train 18," was undertaken by the Integral Coach Factory (ICF) in Chennai, with the aim of creating a high-speed train that could reach speeds of up to 180 km/h (112 mph). The project was led by Sudhanshu Mani, a senior railway official, who worked closely with a team of engineers and designers to develop the trainset. The design and manufacturing process took nearly three years, with the first prototype being rolled out in October 2018.

##Introduction and further (2019–present)

The Vande Bharat Express was officially launched on February 15, 2019, by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The train was introduced on the Delhi-Varanasi route, with a journey time of just under eight hours, compared to the previous journey time of around 12 hours. The train has since been introduced on several other routes, including Delhi-Katra and Mumbai-Ahmedabad. Indian Railways plans to introduce more Vande Bharat Express trains in the coming years, with the aim of increasing the frequency and reach of the service.

#Rolling stock

The Vande Bharat Express consists of 16 coaches, including two executive class coaches, 14 chair car coaches, and two driving cars. The coaches are designed to be lightweight and aerodynamic, with a focus on reducing drag and increasing speed. The train is powered by a 5,600 horsepower electric traction system, which allows it to reach speeds of up to 180 km/h (112 mph). The train has a number of advanced features, including automatic doors, LED lighting, and advanced braking systems.

The coaches are also equipped with a number of passenger amenities, including comfortable seating, air conditioning, and on-board entertainment systems. The executive class coaches have additional amenities, including reclining seats, adjustable headrests, and complimentary meal service.

#Facilities

The Vande Bharat Express offers a number of facilities to passengers, including:

* Air conditioning and comfortable seating
* On-board entertainment systems, including TVs and Wi-Fi
* Complimentary meal service in executive class
* Automatic doors and advanced braking systems
* LED lighting and advanced climate control systems

The train also has a number of safety features, including:

* Advanced braking systems, including regenerative braking
* Automatic fire detection and suppression systems
* CCTV cameras and emergency response systems

#Services

The Vande Bharat Express operates on several routes, including:

* Delhi-Varanasi: The train was introduced on this route in February 2019, with a journey time of just under eight hours.
* Delhi-Katra: The train was introduced on this route in October 2019, with a journey time of around six hours.
* Mumbai-Ahmedabad: The train was introduced on this route in December 2019, with a journey time of around five hours.

Indian Railways plans to introduce more Vande Bharat Express trains in the coming years, with the aim of increasing the frequency and reach of the service.

* Shatabdi Express
* Rajdhani Express

#Notes

The Vande Bharat Express is a significant milestone in India's efforts to modernize its rail network. The train's introduction marks a new era in high-speed rail travel in India, and is expected to have a major impact on the country's transportation sector.

The 2022 AFF Women's Championship was the 12th edition of the AFF Women's Championship, a biennial international women's football tournament organized by the ASEAN Football Federation (AFF). The tournament was held in the Philippines from July 4 to July 17, 2022. A total of 11 teams participated in the tournament, with the Philippines serving as the host nation.

Endorsements in the 2023 Australian Indigenous Voice referendum

The 2023 Australian Indigenous Voice referendum was a national vote held on a proposed constitutional amendment to enshrine an Indigenous Voice to Parliament in the Australian Constitution. The referendum was held on a date to be determined, with the campaign period preceding it seeing various endorsements from different groups and individuals. This article summarizes the notable endorsements in the Yes and No campaigns, as well as neutral positions taken by some organizations and individuals.

#Yes campaign

The Yes campaign for the Indigenous Voice referendum received endorsements from a broad range of organizations, politicians, and individuals.

##Lead lobby groups

The Yes campaign was led by several prominent lobby groups, including the Uluru Statement Working Group, the From the Heart campaign, and the Australian Indigenous Leadership Centre. These groups played a crucial role in advocating for the Voice and coordinating the Yes campaign.

##Politicians

###Federal

Several federal politicians endorsed the Yes campaign, including Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, Opposition Leader Peter Dutton, and key crossbenchers such as Adam Bandt and David Shoebridge. Other notable federal politicians who supported the Yes campaign included Minister for Indigenous Australians Linda Burney, Shadow Minister for Indigenous Australians Jacqui Lambie, and former Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.

###State and territory

State and territory politicians also endorsed the Yes campaign, with several premiers and chief ministers expressing their support. These included New South Wales Premier Chris Minns, Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews, Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk, Western Australian Premier Mark McGowan, South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas, Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff, and Australian Capital Territory Chief Minister Andrew Barr.

##Political parties

###Federal

The Yes campaign received endorsements from several federal political parties, including the Australian Labor Party, the Australian Greens, and the Centre Alliance. The Liberal Party of Australia and the National Party of Australia also supported the Yes campaign, although some individual members expressed reservations.

###State and territory

State and territory branches of the Labor Party, Greens, and Liberal Party also endorsed the Yes campaign. The Tasmanian Greens and the South Australian Greens were among the first parties to publicly support the Voice.

Many local governments across Australia endorsed the Yes campaign, including several city councils and shire councils. The Australian Local Government Association also supported the Voice.

##Land councils

##Legal profession

The legal profession was broadly supportive of the Yes campaign, with several law firms and legal organizations endorsing the Voice. The Australian Bar Association, the Law Council of Australia, and the Australian Lawyers Alliance were among the notable organizations that supported the Yes campaign.

##Sporting organisations and athletes

###Bodies

###Clubs

Many sports clubs, including several AFL and NRL teams, endorsed the Yes campaign. These included the Richmond Football Club, the West Coast Eagles, and the Sydney Swans.

###Prominent athletes

Prominent athletes such as Cathy Freeman, Ian Thorpe, and Nova Peris endorsed the Yes campaign. Other notable athletes who supported the Voice included Patrick Dangerfield, Eddie Betts, and Tamsin Cook.

##Businesses

Several businesses endorsed the Yes campaign, including major corporations such as BHP, Rio Tinto, and Telstra. Other notable businesses that supported the Voice included the Commonwealth Bank, Westpac, and the Australian Institute of Management.

##Directors for the Voice

A group of prominent business leaders, known as the Directors for the Voice, publicly endorsed the Yes campaign. The group included several high-profile CEOs and company directors.

##Religious organisations and leaders

Several religious organizations and leaders endorsed the Yes campaign, including the Catholic Church, the Anglican Church, and the Uniting Church. Other notable religious leaders who supported the Voice included the Australian Jewish community's Rabbi Jonathan Keren-Black and the Australian Islamic community's Dr. Rateb Jneid.

##The arts

###Organisations

Arts organizations, such as the National Association for the Visual Arts and the Australian Writers' Guild, also supported the Voice.

##Other notable individuals

Other notable individuals who endorsed the Yes campaign included several high-profile Australians, such as actor Hugh Jackman, musician Paul Kelly, and author Thomas Keneally.

#No campaign

The No campaign for the Indigenous Voice referendum received endorsements from a smaller but still significant range of organizations, politicians, and individuals.
